q1.question: Can you guarantee legal compliance?
q1.answer: No tool can guarantee 100% legal compliance in all contexts. VexNexa detects and reports issues, assists remediation, and helps you adhere to WCAG and related standards. For legal risk assessment, consider an expert audit and ongoing governance process.

q2.question: How do page limits work?
q2.answer: Each plan includes a monthly page scan limit. A 'page' is one URL scanned. If you scan the same page multiple times in a month, each scan counts toward your limit. When you approach your limit, you'll receive a notification.

q3.question: What if I exceed my plan?
q3.answer: Free Trial: Service is blocked at limit. Upgrade to a paid plan to continue scanning. Paid plans: Service continues but you'll receive notifications to upgrade if you consistently exceed your limits.

q4.question: Do you support teams/SSO?
q4.answer: Pro plans support up to 5 team members. Business plans support up to 15 members with role-based access. SSO is available on Business and Enterprise plans. Contact us for Enterprise features.

q5.question: Can I export reports?
q5.answer: PDF export is available on all paid plans. Word export is available on Pro and Business plans. All exports include your scan results, prioritized issues, code snippets, and remediation recommendations.

q6.question: What's monitored continuously?
q6.answer: Continuous monitoring allows you to schedule automatic scans (daily, weekly, or monthly). You'll receive email alerts when scores drop or new issues are detected. This feature is available on Pro and Business plans.

q7.question: Do I need to schedule a demo?
q7.answer: No! VexNexa is 100% self-serve. Sign up, enter your URL, and get your accessibility report in minutes. We don't offer demos or sales calls.

q8.question: Is VexNexa an accessibility overlay?
q8.answer: No. We scan your code structure and give you WCAG violations to fix properly. We never inject widgets or scripts into your site. Overlays are controversial in the accessibility communityâ€”we analyze your actual code instead.

q9.question: Can VexNexa automatically fix issues?
q9.answer: No. Real accessibility requires proper code changes. We show you exactly what's wrong and how to fix it, but you need to make the changes yourself. Automated 'fixes' don't address root causes.

compliance.title: Compliance Disclaimer
compliance.warning: No tool can guarantee 100% legal compliance in all contexts.
compliance.description: VexNexa detects and reports issues, assists remediation, and helps you adhere to WCAG and related standards. For legal risk assessment, consider an expert audit and ongoing governance process. Our scanner is a tool to assist your compliance efforts, not a legal guarantee.

comparison.title: How VexNexa Compares
comparison.subtitle: Comparing our approach to overlay widgets and generic accessibility scanners
comparison.disclaimer: Overlay widgets inject JavaScript that attempts to modify your site on the client side. While they may help some users, they don't fix underlying code issues and can create new accessibility problems. Generic scanners often miss context-specific issues. VexNexa provides deeper automated coverage and actionable guidance for developers.

faq.subtitle: Quick answers to the most common questions

q1.question: How quickly will I get a response?
q1.answer: We respond within 24 hours on business days. For Team demos and sales we try to respond within 4 hours.

q2.question: Can you give a custom demo?
q2.answer: Certainly. We'd be happy to give a personal demo using your own website as an example. Schedule a 30-minute call via the form or the 'Schedule a call' button.

q3.question: Do you offer training and consultancy?
q3.answer: We respond within 24-48 hours on business days for enterprise inquiries. For general support, use our in-app help or email support.

q4.question: How does enterprise support work?
q4.answer: Enterprise gets dedicated support, SSO, custom branding and optional on-premise deployment. Contact us for details.

q5.question: Do I need to book a demo?
q5.answer: No! You can start scanning immediately after signup. Just register and begin - no meetings required.

hero.title: About VexNexa â€” part of VexNexa
hero.subtitle: We make accessibility workable for busy teams. Less noise, more real improvements with clear priorities and concrete fixes.

cta.startFreeScanAriaLabel: Start your first free WCAG scan

whyWeExist.title: Why we exist
whyWeExist.paragraph1: Teams often drown in reports full of noise: technical jargon, vague references, and little guidance. Meanwhile, the pressure grows: stricter legislation, users with diverse needs, and the simple fact that accessible sites perform better.
whyWeExist.paragraph2: VexNexa turns that around. We show exactly what's wrong, what has priority, and how to fix it â€” so the team can start today.
whyWeExist.paragraph3: Accessibility doesn't have to feel complex. It should be practical, understandable, and action-oriented.

whatMakesUsDifferent.title: What makes us different
whatMakesUsDifferent.subtitle: Five reasons why teams choose VexNexa

vexnexaQuality.title: VexNexa quality
vexnexaQuality.description: Rule sets tuned to axe-core + our filtering. Less noise, more real issues with user impact.

actionableReports.title: Action-oriented reports
actionableReports.description: No jargon â€” concrete steps, code examples, and context per issue.

smartPrioritization.title: Smart prioritization
smartPrioritization.description: Critical, Serious, Moderate, Minor â€” start where the impact is greatest.

transparentSecure.title: Transparent & secure

valuesTeam.quote: Accessibility is not a checkbox â€” it's product craftsmanship. It's about respect for all people who want to use your product.

q1.question: Does a scan mean full WCAG compliance?
q1.answer: No. Automated checks cover the automatically testable criteria. Manual testing remains necessary. VexNexa does catch most common issues.

q2.question: Can I scan multiple pages or sites?
q2.answer: Yes. Depending on your plan, you can include multiple pages per scan. Site-wide crawling (beta) automatically finds subpages.

q3.question: Can I share reports with team or clients?
q3.answer: Absolutely. Each report has a shareable link and export to PDF/Word â€” handy for presentations and audits.

q4.question: What about privacy and data security?
q4.answer: We only scan publicly accessible content and don't store personal data. EU hosting, TLS, and data minimization.

q5.question: Why does VexNexa invoice?
q5.answer: VexNexa is a product of VexNexa. Contracts, invoicing, and support run through VexNexa for clear responsibilities.

q6.question: Can I try VexNexa for free?
q6.answer: Yes. You get one free scan weekly. Registration required; no credit card needed.

finalCta.subtitle: Start with a free scan and see immediately which improvements have the most impact. No meetings required.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about VexNexa

privacy.question: How does VexNexa handle privacy?
privacy.answer: We only scan publicly accessible content and don't store personal data. Our scans are fully GDPR compliant and we don't share data with third parties.

performance.question: Does scanning impact my website's performance?
performance.answer: No, our scans have no noticeable impact on your website. We simulate a normal visitor and don't perform stress tests. Scans run in the background without straining your site.

cookies.question: Do I need to accept cookies to use VexNexa?
cookies.answer: Basic functionality works without cookies. We only use cookies for analytics (optional) and to remember your preferences. You can refuse all cookies and the tool remains fully functional.

international.question: Can I scan international websites?
international.answer: Yes! VexNexa works with websites in all languages and countries. We support international character sets and can scan websites regardless of location or language of content.

account.question: Do I need an account or can I create teams?
account.answer: For basic use, no account is needed - you can scan directly. For advanced features like saved scans, exports and team collaboration, you can create a free account.

support.question: What kind of support do I get?
support.answer: All users get email support. Free plan: 72 hour response time. Pro plan: 24 hours. Team plan: priority support within 4 hours. Plus extensive documentation and video tutorials.

cta.subtitle: Start improving your website's accessibility today. Free for 1 scan per week (registration required).

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Read our privacy policy: how VexNexa handles your data, cookies and privacy. GDPR compliant.
privacy.description: How VexNexa handles your personal data and protects your privacy.

summary.title: Privacy at a glance
summary.description: The most important points in one overview.
doItems: Store data securely in the EU
dontItems: Store personal data from page content

section1.title: 1. Who we are
section1.content: VexNexa is an accessibility-scanning service developed in the Netherlands. We help website owners make their sites more accessible by testing WCAG compliance.
section1.companyValue: VexNexa B.V. (VexNexa is part of VexNexa)

section2.title: 2. What data we collect
scanDataItems: IP address for rate-limiting and abuse prevention
section2.importantNote: we do not store personal data from page content (such as names, emails, phone numbers); we only analyze HTML structure and accessibility.

section3.title: 3. Legal basis (Art. 6 GDPR)
items: Performance of contract â€“ scans, results, account management.
Legitimate interest â€“ security (rate-limiting, abuse detection), basic improvements.
Consent â€“ analytics/marketing cookies and any opt-in communication.
Legal obligation â€“ retention requirements and requests from authorities.

section4.title: 4. Cookies and tracking
section4.analyticsIntro: With consent, we may use privacy-friendly analytics (e.g., Vercel Analytics or alternative). We measure aggregated statistics, not individual profiles.
section4.manageText: You can manage consent through the
section4.utmText: We may temporarily store UTM parameters to understand origin. These contain no personal data.

section5.title: 5. How and why we use data
section5.noSelling: We do not sell or rent your data to third parties for marketing purposes.

section6.title: 6. Recipients and processors
section6.intro: We only share data with service providers who process on our behalf under a data processing agreement.

section7.title: 7. Transfers outside EU/EEA
section7.content: If transfers outside the EU take place (e.g., edge-routing or support logs), we use appropriate safeguards such as EU Standard Contractual Clauses and additional measures.

section8.title: 8. Data storage, security & retention
retentionItems: Scan data: 1 year (Free); longer for paid accounts (configurable in your account)
Account data: until account deletion or as long as legally required
Analytics: up to 24 months (aggregated/anonymized where possible)
section8.retentionNote: We delete or anonymize earlier when data is no longer needed, unless retention is legally required.

section9.title: 9. Your rights (GDPR/AVG)
section9.accessDesc: Request what data we have about you.
section9.portabilityDesc: Receive data in a common format.
section9.objectionDesc: Object to processing based on legitimate interest.

section10.title: 10. Children
section10.content: Not directed at children under 16 years. Contact us if data has been collected; we will delete it.

section11.title: 11. Data breaches
section11.content: We immediately investigate the impact, limit risks and report if required to the Dutch Data Protection Authority and affected parties.

section12.title: 12. Automated decision-making
section12.content: We do not make decisions based solely on automated processing with legal effects for you.

section13.title: 13. Changes to this policy
section13.content: We communicate significant changes via email (if applicable), a notification on the site and update of the date.

section14.title: 14. Contact & complaints
section14.notSatisfied: Not satisfied? File a complaint with the Dutch Data Protection Authority via
